impact-statement: Adapting a cytosolic enzyme that breaks down glutathione to function in the lumen of the endoplasmic reticulum challenges the long-held view that reduced glutathione fuels disulfide rearrangements during protein folding.

competing-interest.conf2: The other authors declare that no competing interests exist.

contribution.con1: ST, Designed, executed and interpreted the cell biological experiments shown in <xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig2 fig4 fig5 fig6">Figures 2, 4, 5 and 6</xref> and the in vivo redox measurements of <xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig3 fig4">Figures 3 and 4</xref>
contribution.con2: EA, Oversaw the design, execution and interpretation of the fluorescent based measurements in <xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig1 fig3 fig4">Figures 1, 3 and 4</xref>
contribution.con3: AZ, Designed, executed, interpreted and led the biochemical and biophysical experiments characterizing ChaC1 in vitro, shown in <xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig1">Figure 1</xref> and <xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig1s1">Figure 1—figure supplement 1</xref>
contribution.con4: TK, Contributed to the design, execution, and interpretation of the in vivo redox measurements in <xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig3 fig4">Figures 3 & 4</xref>
contribution.con5: LM-S, Contributed to the design, execution, and interpretation of the in vitro redox measurements of <xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig3">Figure 3</xref>
contribution.con6: EPM, Contributed to the design, execution, and interpretation of the in vitro redox measurements of <xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig3">Figure 3</xref>
contribution.con7: HPH, Oversaw and contributed to the design and interpretation of in vitro measurements of ChaC1's biochemical properties (<xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig1">Figure 1</xref>) and to execution of some of the cell biological experiments (<xref ref-type="fig" rid="fig2 fig6">Figures 2 & 6</xref>) as well as to the writing and editing of the manuscript
contribution.con8: DR, Conceived and oversaw the study as a whole, wrote the manuscript, designed and constructed expression plasmids for the study
